main event: An unusual object was sighted at Neubiburg, Germany on 11 October 1951 by several German Army personnel.
interesting points: The object was described as a circular, brilliant white light larger than a star,It was visible for about 5 to 7 minutes,The object moved rapidly in a straight line, stopped, and then moved slowly in an erratic course,The object remained motionless for about 1 minute before moving,The appearance and behavior of the object did not conform to known aircraft.
witness description: Military personnel, including at least two airmen and Sergeant Robert E. Vick
